channel.title: Need help in mysql and server integrating
channel.description: Hi i've searched fru all the forums i could fink about but i could not find anything wof mysql and server integrating so i'm asking all codes to help me make this stuff i need simple stuff like make server connect to mysql DB named members witch is on my PC my ip is 87.247.72.147 and would read admins,members,moderators from table of DB thanks

item.dc:creator: @ltownerlt ltownerlt
item.description:
@ltownerlt wrote:

dont work and loaded doesnt apear maby you can tell me what source you are using cuz i’m using richscape heres what server.bat prints RichScape is now Online. Created by Rich. Connected! Client type: high memory version UserId: 66199224 ST is signing onto server. LOADED: 3 [client-1-ST]: Loading finished. [client-1-ST]: Text [0,0]: ;kl; [client-1-ST]: Text [0,0]: kj;jk; [client-1-ST]: Unhandled packet [77, InterFaceId: 23269, size=12]: ]65 E9 B0 24 22 40 26 8E 53 8B 11 00[ [client-1-ST]: Action Button: 91063

Tell me ur client.java and server.java imports maby mine are missing somethings

P.S. maby i need to type import sql.*; to client.java cuz ita ain there but when i do i get this error: :: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_05 :: Results: client.java:669: reference to Date is ambiguous, both class java.sql.Date in jav a.sql and class java.util.Date in java.util match public String date = new SimpleDateFormat("MM/dd/yyyy").format(new Date()); //no need to be in process and cause extra lag ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Need help in mysql and server integrating
item.dc:creator: @_Steven ©Steven©
item.description:
@_Steven wrote:

Hmm, well i got it too load the admins again.

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java" -Didea.launcher.port=7549 "-Didea.launcher.bin.path=C:\Program Files\JetBrains\IntelliJ IDEA 8.0M1\bin" -Dfile.encoding=windows-1252 -classpath "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\charsets.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\deploy.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\javaws.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\jce.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\jsse.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\management-agent.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\plugin.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\resources.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\rt.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\ext\dnsns.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\ext\localedata.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\ext\sunjce_provider.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\ext\sunmscapi.jar;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\jre\lib\ext\sunpkcs11.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Steven\Desktop\mysql-connector-java-5.1.6.jar;C:\Documents and Settings\Steven\My Documents\rs2dv\Databse\out\production\Databse;C:\Program Files\JetBrains\IntelliJ IDEA 8.0M1\lib\idea_rt.jar" com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain MySQL.Connect
Connected!
Admin: Loaded!

Process finished with exit code 0

Alright well, try this. this is that last attempt because this works for me. 100%

public class Connect {
    private String url = "jdbc:mysql://87.247.72.147:3306/members";
    private String user = "USERNAME";
    private String password = "PASSWORD";
    private Connection con;

    public Connection getCon() {
        return con;
    }

    public void setCon(Connection con) {
        this.con = con;
    }

    public String getUrl() {
        return url;
    }

    public void setUrl(String url) {
        this.url = url;
    }

    public String getUser() {
        return user;
    }

    public void setUser(String user) {
        this.user = user;
    }


    public String getPassword() {
        return password;
    }

    public void setPassword(String password) {
        this.password = password;
    }

    public boolean connect() {
        try {
            Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver");

            con = DriverManager.getConnection(
                    url, user, password);
            System.out.println("Connected!");
            return true;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
            System.out.println("Connection Failed!");
            return false;
        }
    }
}

^
Connect.java

    public static Connect con = new Connect();
    public static Statement state;
    public static String stmt = "SELECT * FROM admins";

    public int checkadmins(String name) {
        try {
            con.setCon(DriverManager.getConnection(con.getUrl(), con.getUser(), con.getPassword()));

            state = con.getCon().createStatement();
            ResultSet rs;
            rs = state.executeQuery(stmt);
            while (rs.next()) {
                if (name.equalsIgnoreCase(rs.getString(1))) {
                    System.out.println("Loaded!");
                    return 5;
                }
            }
            state.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return 0;
    }

Load Admins Method
NOTE:
If
“Loaded!”
is printed out, the code works.

item.title: Need help in mysql and server integrating
item.dc:creator: @_Steven ©Steven©
item.description:
@_Steven wrote:

Connected! isAdmin: ST: True!

Process finished with exit code 0

Delete everything in Connect.java
and replace it with



import java.sql.DriverManager;
import java.sql.Connection;

/**
 * Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
 * User: Steven
 * Date: 15-Sep-2008
 * Time: 19:22:43
 */

public class Connect {
    private String url = "jdbc:mysql://87.247.72.147:3306/members";
    private String user = "USERNAME";
    private String password = "PASSWORD";
    private Connection con;
    public static Connect me = new Connect();

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        me.connect();
    }

    public boolean connect() {
        try {
            Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver");

            con = DriverManager.getConnection(
                            url, user, password);
            System.out.println("Connected!");
            return true;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
            System.out.println("Connection Failed!");
            return false;
        }
    }
    public String getUser() {
        return user;
    }
    public void setUser(String user) {
        this.user = user;
    }
    public String getPassword() {
        return password;
    }
    public void setPassword(String password) {
        this.password = password;
    }
    public Connection getCon() {
        return con;
    }
    public void setCon(Connection con) {
        this.con = con;
    }
    public String getUrl() {
        return url;
    }
    public void setUrl(String url) {
        this.url = url;
    }
}

And replace

    public int checkadmins() {
        try {
            while (rs.next()) {
                String plrName = rs.getString("PLR NAME COL");
                if (PlayerName.equalsIgnoreCase(plrName)) {
                    return 5;
                }
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Critical error while checking administrators!");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return 0;
    }

With

    public Connect con = new Connect();
    public Statement state;
    public String stmt = "SELECT * FROM administrators";

    public int checkadmins() {
        try {
            con.setCon(DriverManager.getConnection(con.getUrl(), con.getUser(), con.getPassword()));

            state = con.getCon().createStatement();            
            ResultSet rs;
            rs = state.executeQuery(stmt);
            while (rs.next()) {
                if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(rs.getString(1))) {
                    return 5;
                }
            }
            state.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return 0;
    }

    public Connect con = new Connect();
    public int checkadmins() {
        try {
            con.setCon(DriverManager.getConnection(con.getUrl(), con.getUser(), con.getPassword()));

            stmt = con.getCon().createStatement();

                }
            }
            stmt.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Critical error while checking administrators!");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return 0;
